intro: Dyerella scabriuscula, commonly known as the rough-stemmed dyerella, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Dyerella scabriuscula is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
